poem:
**Uncertain Balance**

Andrew speaks of shrouded rates,  
where trade winds shift, and markets wait.  
India and Britain shake hands in May,  
promises weave through economic clay.  
Brexit's echo, a drumbeat near,  
in shadows, futures tread unclear.  
Unravel and weave, the financial thread—  
a tapestry of gold and lead.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Bank of England governor warns path of interest rate cuts is ‘shrouded in uncertainty’ due to trade turmoil – business live 12.04pm BST Turning to trade deals, BoE governor Andrew Bailey says that it’s “really good” to see the trade deal between the UK and India agreed in early May. But, he warns, it will take time to see the economic benefits, as trade patterns adjust. He reminds MPs that in the short-term, Brexit will". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
